item.title: Meta Studio Shutdowns Reportedly Hit Sanzaru Games, Twisted Pixel
item.content:encoded:
It looks as though Deadpool VR studio Twisted Pixel and Sly Cooper: Thieves in Time outfit Sanzaru Games have been shut down by their parent company Meta as part of a wider employee and studio cull.

Speaking on social media platform X, Twisted Pixel designer Andy Gentile announced earlier today that he had been laid off, and that it "appears the entire Twisted Pixel studio has been shut down" alongside Sanzaru.

Gentile's report of Sanzaru's shutdown was corroborated by senior level designer Ray West on LinkedIn (as spotted by VGC), who said that "several game studios", including Sanzaru, have been shut down by Meta today.

Twisted Pixel and Sanzaru's shutdown are likely part of plans Meta apparently has to cut roughly 10% of the employees in its Reality Labs business, which works primarily on VR and AR content, as reported by the New York Times.

That would include both studios; Twisted Pixel's last game was Marvel's Deadpool VR, released last year, while Sanzaru's most recent titles are both in the Asgard's Wrath series, which was created for VR headsets.

According to the New York Times' report, these cuts are part of a general shift in terms of Meta's direction, with the company now planning to focus more of its resources into the development of AI systems.

Generative AI has proven to be a controversial subject in the gaming industry, with some major companies embracing the technology while others excoriate it for its environmental impact and the (perceived) poor quality of the assets it generates.

Unfortunately, Sanzaru and Twisted Pixel aren't the only studios to lose employees or be shut down recently. They join the likes of Ubisoft's Halifax division, Squid Game: Unleashed developer Boss Fight, and Metal: Hellsinger studio The Outsiders, to name but a few.

Neither Sanzaru nor Twisted Pixel's shutdown have been officially confirmed by studio management, and Meta hasn't provided an official comment either. Stay tuned for more.

Joe has been writing for TechRaptor for several years, and in those years has learned a lot about the gaming industry and its foibles. He’s originally an… More about Joseph

item.title: Battlefield 6 Season 2 Delayed to Mid-February, Season 1 to Be Extended
item.content:encoded:
Battlefield 6 Season 2 won't be arriving until mid-February, EA and its collective Battlefield development studios have announced, but there will be more content as part of Season 1 to compensate for the delay.

In a news post on the official Battlefield website, EA says Season 2 of Battlefield 6 is now coming on February 17th, and that a so-called "extension update" will be arriving for Season 1 on January 20th, bringing with it new Battle Pass content and more.

EA says the extension update for Season 1 will include "new weekly challenges, a Bonus Path, and a continuation of the Season 1 Battle Pass until the start date of Season 2" to give you something to do while you wait.

The bonus path in question is called Frostfire, and it's launching a week later than the extension update on January 27th. It'll include extra rewards for both the free and paid paths of the Battle Pass.

You can complete this path alongside the main Season 1 route as well, so you don't need to worry about whether you're accruing XP for one or the other; they'll both progress beside one another.

Additionally, there won't be any Bonus Challenges for the Frostfire path; unlike previous bonus paths, everything you need to unlock things from Frostfire will be earnable through weekly challenges.

If you're unfamiliar, Battlefield 6 is the latest entry in the Battlefield series of first-person shooters. It reintroduces a single-player campaign alongside the game's signature multiplayer gameplay, which features a number of tweaks and changes compared to Battlefield 2042.

The game has proven a smash hit for EA; it racked up seven million sales within its first week of launch, going on to become October's best-selling game across all platforms in the US.

You can check out Battlefield 6 right now on PC, PlayStation 5, and Xbox Series X|S. Season 2 begins on February 17th.
